intro: Zornia harmsiana, commonly known as the Harms' zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid regions. Zornia harmsiana is an annual herb that produces small pods containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native range.
